parse.title: Baby black dragon

Baby black dragon

Baby black dragons are the offspring of adult black dragons and are the strongest baby dragons in the game. Unlike their adult form, they are too young to breathe dragonfire, so an anti-dragon shield or other protection from dragonbreath is not needed to fight them. However, players may still need to bring protection, as they are found in locations that also contain adult dragons.

One baby black dragon can be found inside the Evil Chicken's Lair; it is reachable by using a rope on a hole towards the back of the cave (the rope will disappear after a few minutes). However, as there is only one spawn, it is not recommended to kill them there. Several may be found with the green dragons in the Chaos Tunnels, which is the only reliable location to kill them for a black dragon Slayer task if one is not strong enough to face the adult variant reliably.

Despite being dragons, they don't count for the dragons Slayer assignment.

While they are much easier than an adult black dragon, it is not recommended to fight baby black dragons for a Slayer task unless absolutely necessary, due to poor xp and drops. Their baby dragon bones can be buried for 30 Prayer experience (and automatically so with the bonecrusher), but their resourcefulness essentially ends there.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Chaos Tunnels70None10Maplink
Evil Chicken's Lair70None1Maplink

They are best killed in the southeasternmost chamber of the Chaos Tunnels, as it does not have lava pools getting in the way nor the aggressive animated spade of the other chamber.

Drops[edit | edit source]

The average Baby black dragon kill is worth 516 coins.

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!

  • update 15 March 2006 (Update):
